findings.lung: The lung bases are grossly clear. No pleural or pericardial effusion.
findings.liver: Normal size with smooth contour. An 8mm slightly T2 hyperintense focus likely represents a summation shadow versus atypical hemangioma or granuloma.
findings.biliary: No significant intra or extrahepatic biliary ductal dilatation.
findings.pancreas: Normal signal intensity and bulk. A punctate T2 hyperintense nonenhancing focus in the tail of the pancreas is most compatible with a side branch IPMN.
findings.spleen: Normal in size and homogeneous in signal characteristics.
findings.kidneys: Normal in size with several punctate T2 hyperintense non-enhancing lesions consistent with cysts.
findings.gastrointestinal tract: Moderate size hiatal hernia. Normal imaged small and large bowel loops.
findings.lymph nodes: Enlarged nodes in the porta hepatis, measuring up to 1.7 x 3.8 cm, unchanged from prior.
findings.osseous: No concerning osseous lesions. Several T2 hyperintense hemangiomas in thoracic spine. Multiple chronic compression deformities involving T11-L1, L3, and L5.

radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Lymph nodes in the porta hepatis are unchanged from prior.
